sect1.title: Webserver URL rewriting rules
sect1.para: This page allows to change the URL rewriting rules of a given virtual directory of the web server.
To remove a parameter click on button next to its value.
To edit a parameter click on button or on "Source pattern" link.
When editing or adding new URL rewrite rule following inputs are applicable:

simplelist.member: Rulelist container: a named container for given rule, default to use '*Main*' container
Pattern Type: the type of the "Request Path pattern" value, one of 'REGEX' or 'sprintf'

Rule matching: The rule behaviour: Normal - stop matching after first non-matching rule, First - stop matching after first matching rule, Last - process all rules last rule which matches the pattern will be used
Request Path pattern: string containing REGEX expression or sprintf pattern to match requested logical path from Web server
Accept Header Request pattern: string containing REGEX expression to match HTTP request Accept header field value, default is empty
Destination Path format: a sprintf format string for composing destination path or URL
Destination format Conversion function: a PL procedure used to convert values extracted from requested path when composing destination path

HTTP Response Code: Internal - the request will be processed by Web server without returning a redirect response to client, 30x - will sent a redirect response to client, 40x - a reject will be sent to client. Default is "Internal" redirect
HTTP Response Headers: HTTP headers to be sent back to client if "HTTP Response Code" is not "Internal" redirect.
